cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: Jerry is forecast to turn north and then northeast, passing near Bermuda and moving into the open North Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Bermuda (close pass, not a direct landfall)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico exposed to long‚Äêperiod swells; St. Croix lies south of the cone and is experiencing only residual swell effects.
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected; only occasional gusty showers.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer-band showers may bring brief downpours, but totals generally light.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells will maintain dangerous surf and rip currents around St. Croix beaches through Monday.
